intro: Ocotea frondosa, commonly known as the Brazilian sandarac tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent. The tree is valued for its timber and has been used traditionally for various purposes.
